alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Converse County Lower Elevations; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Laramie Valley; North Laramie Range; Shirley Basin; Sierra Madre Range; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued April 04 at 3:59PM MDT until April 06 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...West winds 40 to 55 mph with gusts up to 80 mph expected. Winds may locally exceed 90 MPH near the Sierra Madre Range in the Upper North Platte River Valley. * WHERE...Lower elevations of Carbon and Albany Counties including Muddy Gap, Shirley Basin, Baggs, Rawlins, Saratoga, and Laramie. * WHEN...Until 6 AM MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight and high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers. There will be an extreme risk for vehicle blowovers! Winds of this magnitude may also lead to tree, power line, and property damage. Secure loose items.
info.instruction: A High Wind Warning means a hazardous high wind event is expected or occurring. Sustained wind speeds of at least 40 mph or gusts of 58 mph or more can lead to property damage.
